articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Ryongmun Liquor Factory
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Ryongmun Liquor Factory
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, provided field guidance to the Ryongmun Liquor Factory.
					 He heard a detailed report on the construction of the factory after being briefed on it in front of a huge map showing its panoramic view.
					
					 He said that a modern liquor factory was built as required by the new century and the production of liquor is kept going at a high rate, adding that one more instruction of General Secretary Kim Jong Il has been implemented.
					
					 He learned about production at the factory, looking round water filtering process, liquor production and packing processes, liquor store, products show room and other places.
					
					  Before going round the water filtering process, he asked what spring water is used by the factory, saying that the quality of liquor mainly depends on water quality.
					
					 After being told by officials that it uses spring water gushing out  between natural rocks hundreds of meters away from the production site and the volume of spring water and its physical and chemical nature remain unchanged in all seasons, he learned in detail about the technological features of water filtering process including chlorine filter, ferromanganese filter, quartz sand filter, soft water filter and activated charcoal filter.
					
					 He went round with keen interest liquor production and packing processes.
					
					 Examining bottles and other containers and trademarks used at the factory, he underscored the need to design trademarks better. It is important to design trademarks well as they are widely used for guaranteeing the quality of products and making ads, he noted.
					
					 Watching workers pack products, he underscored the need to put the packing process on a higher level of automation in order to save the manpower and cut down production cost.
					
					 Going round a control room, he called for establishing a modern general command system to more scrupulously organize business management and operation activities. 
					
					 At the store full of products, he learned in detail about storage capacity and carriage of products. He underscored the need to seal them more tightly and take strict measures for ensuring proper temperature and humidity so that their good quality may be preserved.
					
					 At the products show room he saw a diagram on the analysis of their quality in comparison with famous liquors and learned about spirits, volume and quality of varieties of liquors produced at the factory.
					
					 He specified tasks to be fulfilled to produce, manage and operate the factory and ways for doing so.
					
					 He had a photo taken with the workers of the factory.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Chon Chang Bok, Pak Jong Chon and So Hong Chan.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Ministry of Physical Culture and Sports headed by Vice-Minister Son Kwang Ho left here on Saturday to take part in the assembly of the International Weightlifting Federation to be held in Russia and the fifth international conference of ministers of Physical Culture and Sports slated to take place in Germany.
					 Meanwhile, delegations of different countries and regions departed from here on the same day after taking part in the 16th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair.

articles.title: International Tour Boat "Royale Star" Leaves Rajin Port
articles.content:
International Tour Boat Royale Star Leaves Rajin Port
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- A departure ceremony of tour boat Royale Star for the first batch of Rason-Mt. Kumgang international tour makers took place at Rajin Port Saturday.
					 Present there were officials and other personages of the DPRK and Chinese institutions related to tourism, tourists and people in Rason City.
					
					 Jon Tong Chol, director of the Rason City Tourist Administration Bureau, and Zheng Yuanhui, owner of the boat, made speeches there.
					
					 The speakers congratulated the guests on having an opportunity to tour Mt. Kumgang, world famous mountain and a superb scenic beauty, as the first batch of makers of Rason-Mt. Kumgang international tour by the boat.
					
					 They wished the guests pleasant and happy days.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony the boat left the port.

articles.title: Rally Cycling Ends
articles.content:
Rally Cycling Ends
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- A rally cycling which kicked off on May 8 ended on Saturday.
					 It involved time trial and individual races.
					
					 Kim Chol Ryong and Ryang Yu Mi from the Sports Team of the Ministry of Light Industry respectively came first in adult events (men and women) while Song Il of the Ryesonggang Sports Team, and Kim Ok Sim of the Sports Team of the Ministry of Light Industry placed first in the youth events (men and women).

articles.title: Quake Jolts West Sea of Korea
articles.content:
Quake Jolts West Sea of Korea
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- A magnitude-4.9 earthquake occurred in the waters 31 km southwest of Paekryong Island in the West Sea of Korea Saturday, according to south Korean KBS.
					 Tremor was reportedly felt in the buildings in some parts of south Korean Kyonggi Province.

articles.title: Kwangju Popular Uprising
articles.content:
Kwangju Popular Uprising
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- On May 18, 1980, students and other citizens in south Korea's Kwangju City turned out in a massive uprising in protest against the pro-American military fascist rule.
					 The uprisers drove out the heavily-armed martial forces from the city and seized it for ten days, with slogans "Remove emergency martial law", "Abolish Yusin system" and "Go home, Yankees".
					
					 The uprising suffered a failure by brutal crackdown of the military fascist clique, which was engineered by the United States. But it, involving more than one million people, dealt a heavy blow to the colonial fascist rule of the U.S. imperialists and the puppet military dictatorial forces.
					
					 It left a bitter lesson that it is impossible to achieve social progress, national unity and reunification as long as there remain in south Korea the U.S. forces and their followers, the traitors to the nation.
					
					 The present ruling "Saenuri Party" in south Korea is none other than a successor to the then ruling "Democratic Justice Party". It is now planning to put a "bill on dissolution of criminal bodies" through the "National Assembly". Such moves to stamp out the pro-reunification movement remind one of the period of the Chun Doo Hwan military fascist dictatorship, which had been hell-bent on repression of the patriotic forces desirous of independence, democracy and reunification.
					
					 The south Korean people should put an end to the tragic situation in which patriotic deeds are incriminated and justice is calumniated by injustice, and turn out in the struggle for independence and reunification in the same spirit displayed by the Kwangju uprisers.

articles.title: Achievements Made in Developing Science and Technology for Film Industry
articles.content:
Achievements Made in Developing Science and Technology for Film Industry
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- The Research Institute of Cinema Science has promoted the development of the Juche-oriented science and technology for film industry. 
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il clearly  indicated tasks and ways before the institute on May 17 and 18, Juche 62 (1973) and wisely led the work to put film production on a scientific and technological basis.
					
					 The institute has developed into the one with a competent research staff and modern equipment over the past four decades. 
					
					 The researchers there succeeded in setting and coordinating hundreds of film technical indexes and measuring and analyzing methods including shooting conditions, recording level and standard norms of color and temperature. 
					
					 They also manufactured varieties of shooting and lighting optical instruments according to seasons, time and change of colors and temperature and developed substance for makeup. 
					
					 They, at the same time, manufactured a lot of projector reflex-mirrors, microphones, speakers and amplifiers for cinemas, theatres and cultural houses across the country. 
					
					 They conducted a dynamic drive to introduce digitization of film production process in recent years, developing a retrieval system for sound effect data, system for remote control of sound mixing, stereo sound system, etc. 
					
					 Digital image processing technology developed by the institute was introduced to the production of feature films "The Country I Saw" (Parts 2 and 3) and "Distress". 
					
					 The institute completed the Korean-style system for stereo sound revival and technology for increasing the life of movies and developed an electronic projector convenient for use while cutting down electricity consumption. 
					
					 It is now pushing forward the work to radically raise the level of technological representation of Korean films by developing technology for 3D film production and projecting as required by the world trend of film technology.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Turning   Green Mountains, Fields into Eternal Boon to Country's Prosperity
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Turning   Green Mountains, Fields into Eternal Boon to Country's Prosperity 
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- Green mountains and fields serve as eternal boon to guaranteeing the vitality and living of the nation under any circumstances and ensuring the prosperity of all generations to come. Rodong Sinmun Saturday says this in a bylined article. 
					 Green mountains and fields are an icon of a prospering country, it notes, and goes on:
					
					 Green mountains and fields are the inherent picture of just society, socialist society which enables all people to lead a happy life. The great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il devoted their all to the work to turn all the mountains into mountains of treasure and the fields into ones where all crops are abundant and all fruits ripen. This history has been given steady continuity since it began on the socialist principle of giving top priority to the people's interests and living. 
					
					 The mountains and fields were devastated by the Japanese imperialists' plunder and they were reduced to ashes during the Korean War. In the subsequent period they became greener and the foundation of the self-supporting economy grew stronger as the days go by, turning the country into a paradise of people good to live in. 
					
					 The drive to defend the socialist country was like a sacred battle to defend not only its independent dignity but also the green mountains and fields. In that hard period a patriotic work of lasting value to turn the land of the country into the land befitting socialist Korea was carried out and bold and ambitious projects for building gravity-fed waterways were carried out to supply life-giving water to fields of the country. As a result, the farmers have become able to lead a happy life at modern houses as people in urban areas do. 
					
					 Green mountains and fields mean lasting assets for the prosperity of the country. 
					
					 All people are called upon to turn all areas of the country into fields where all crops and fruits ripen in order not to put in vain the precious blood and sweat shed by those who reclaimed tideland by damming off sea waters and cultivated it with good care, tightening their belts.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Marks Anniversary of Kwangju Popular Uprising
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Marks Anniversary of Kwangju Popular Uprising 
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- The aspiration and desire of the people for new politics and life have rapidly grown strong since the "yusin" dictatorship met its end in 1979.
					 Nevertheless, the military gangsters who seized power through the "December 12 army purge coup" responded to the people's growing demand for democracy with the May 17 military fascist action in spring of 1980 by an order of the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 The declaration of "emergency martial law" in the wake of "martial law" which lasted for more than half a year under the reign of the military forces and strengthened fascist dictatorial rule sparked off great resistance of the south Korean people. It triggered off the fierce Kwangju Popular Uprising on May 18.
					
					 The uprisers had put the city under their total control for more than 10 days.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday says in a bylined article in this regard:
					
					 The Kwangju Popular Uprising was patriotic and popular resistance to realize the desire of the south Korean people for independence, democracy and reunification and a heroic armed uprising unprecedented in the modern history of the East.
					
					 The uprising recorded a shining page in the history of the south Korean people's struggle against the U.S. and fascist forces and it still remains a symbol of the patriotic struggle of the people from all walks of life for independence, democracy and reunification.
					
					 What the Kwangju uprisers desired 33 years ago was independence, democracy and reunification. 
					
					 However, foreign forces' domination and their stooges' dictatorial rule are still persisting in south Korea.
					
					 It was none other than the U.S. which instigated the south Korean troops to put down the uprising at the point of bayonet. It was again the U.S. which zealously patronized and backed the military gangsters in their operation to turn Kwangju into a scene of genocide. It was none other than the U.S. which wirepulled the pro-U.S. conservative forces' seizure of power after ouster of pro-democracy and reform forces in a bid to put an end to the June 15 era of reunification.
					
					 In order to translate the desire of the participants in the uprising into a reality, it is necessary to terminate the U.S. imperialists' colonial domination over south Korea and achieve the democratic development of society, concludes the article.

articles.title: End to Unpopular Education Policy Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
End to Unpopular Education Policy Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- The Teachers Trade Union of south Korea held a rally outside Posin Pavilion in Seoul on Tuesday, calling for putting an end to the unpopular education policy.
					 At the rally speakers charged that education for the privileged is in force at schools and violence against students is daily occurrence.
					
					 Consequently, students are choosing to commit suicides, wriggling in despair, they said, adding this is evidently a social murder.
					
					 Only when the unpopular education policy is terminated and human rights are guaranteed, is it possible to protect students, they stressed.
					
					 They called for turning out in the drive to enforce proper education.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive Accused of Betraying Interests of Workers
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive Accused of Betraying Interests of Workers
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- It has been disclosed that the present chief executive of south Korea made pro-U.S. sycophantic remarks for betraying interests of workers to a big U.S. business during her trip to the U.S., sparking off big furor.
					 No sooner had the president of the General Motors of the U.S. requested a solution to a wage issue under the pretext of investment in south Korea at a meeting sponsored by the U.S. Chamber of Commerce and Industry on May 8 than the chief executive of south Korea accepted it.
					
					 She promised to have the wage issue handled in favor of the U.S. business at a time when south Korean workers were staging an action after filing a suit over the wage issue. This behavior is touching off outcries among south Korean workers.
					
					 The Confederation of Trade Unions held a press conference in Seoul on May 14.
					
					 At the press conference the organization charged that the promise made by the chief executive to comply with the demand of a U.S. businessman, without hearing opinions of workers, was a silly and reckless behavior more serious than Yun Chang Jung's case.
					
					 The workers will never remain a passive bystander to such act favoring the interests of the U.S. plutocrat only, it warned.
					
					 Censuring her humiliating junket, the organization urged her to immediately rescind her promise and apologize to the people for it.
					
					 The opposition parties released statements and commentaries on May 13, stating that what she said is evidently something that deserves impeachment.
					
					 Media also deplored the humiliating diplomacy of the chief executive.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Report, Conclusion at Plenary Meeting of C.C., WPK Carried by Bangladeshi Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Report, Conclusion at Plenary Meeting of C.C., WPK Carried by Bangladeshi Paper
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- The Bangladeshi paper The Daily Folk on May 10 carried the full texts of a report and conclusion made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un at the March 2013 Plenary Meeting of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The report and conclusion made by him on March 31, Juche 102 (2013) set forth a new strategic line on simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force as required by the situation and the developing Korean revolution and indicates the tasks and ways for its implementation.

articles.title: WPK's New Strategic Line Favored by Swiss Organizations
articles.content:
WPK's New Strategic Line Favored by Swiss Organizations
Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on May 10 posted on their websites an article titled "New strategic line of WPK is a line of winning victory of Songun revolution".
					 The historic plenary meeting of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) held on March 31 set forth a strategic line on simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force, the article said, and went on:
					
					 The WPK's strategic line of building a thriving nation and achieving national reunification is a brilliant succession of the original line on simultaneously developing economic construction and defence upbuilding which was advanced and thoroughly implemented by President Kim Il Sung and General  Secretary Kim Jong Il and development of the line at a new high stage.
					
					 The new line laid down by the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un serves as a powerful weapon for resolutely foiling the moves of the U.S. imperialists, the south Korean puppet forces and hostile forces for aggression and defending the sovereignty of the country and a most powerful treasured sword for carrying out the Songun revolution.
					
					 The DPRK's access to nuclear weapons is a legitimate right of the Korean people.
					
					 It can never become any bargaining chip and the Korean people will never abandon it as long as the U.S. imperialists persist in their hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 The WPK's new line fully demonstrated the rare wisdom of Kim Jong Un leading the Korean nation to prosperity in the 21st century.

articles.title: U.S. Is to Blame for Tension on Korean Peninsula: Newspaper
articles.content:
U.S. Is to Blame for Tension on Korean Peninsula: Newspaper
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- Halo Noviny, a newspaper of the Czech Republic, on May 11 carried an article titled "Does the U.S. truly want dialogue?"
					 The recently escalating tension on the Korean Peninsula is attributable to the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and its military pressure on the latter, the paper said, and went on:
					
					 The DPRK successfully launched a satellite in December 12 last year. But the U.S. prodded the UN Security Council into cooking up an unreasonable "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK, terming its satellite launch a "long-range missile launch". The DPRK countered it with its third underground nuclear test for self-defence.
					
					 Though it was a just step, the U.S. again prodded the UNSC into faking up "a resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK and staged the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises on the Korean Peninsula with huge forces involved.
					
					 U.S. nuclear strike means were involved in the joint military drills. Recently the U.S. and south Korea advanced a "proposal for dialogue" to the DPRK but with preconditions.
					
					 The U.S. urged the DPRK to show its will for denuclearization as a precondition for dialogue. The DPRK turned down the U.S. "proposal for dialogue" as it sought a sinister purpose.
					
					 It is hard to expect peace on the Korean Peninsula unless the U.S. gives up its hostile policy and nuclear threat to the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK and the U.S. are still technically at war as the 1950-1953 Korean war ended with the conclusion of the armistice agreement, not a peace treaty.
					
					 The DPRK has so far called for signing a peace treaty on a number of occasions but it was rejected by the U.S. It has turned its face away from the DPRK's proposal as it required the tension on the Korean Peninsula for carrying out its strategy.
					
					 The U.S. has drastically increased forces in and around south Korea under the pretext of "nuclear threat" from the DPRK.
					
					 All these facts go to clearly prove who is to blame for the tension on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Barco de turismo "Estrella Real" sale del puerto de Rajin rumbo al monte Kumgang
articles.content:
Barco de turismo "Estrella Real" sale del puerto de Rajin rumbo al monte Kumgang
Pyongyang, 18 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 18 en el puerto de Rajin la ceremonia de primera salida del barco de turismo "Estrella Real" para el turismo internacional Rason-Monte Kumgang.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los funcionarios y personalidades de las unidades coreanas y chinas relacionadas con el turismo, los miembros del grupo de turistas y trabajadores de la ciudad de Rason.
					
					 Pronunciaron discursos Jon Tong Chol, titular de la Direccion de Turismo de la ciudad de Rason, y Zheng Yuanhui, dueno del barco.
					
					Los oradores felicitaron a los huespedes que recorreran el monte de fama mundial Kumgang gracias al inicio del turismo por el barco "Estrella Real".
					
					Desearon que los turistas pasen tiempo alegre y agradable.
					
					Terminada la ceremonia, la nave "Estrella Real" comenzo a navegar con turistas a bordo.

articles.title: Terminado torneo de ciclismo en la RPDC
articles.content:
Terminado torneo de ciclismo en la RPDC
Pyongyang, 18 de mayo (ACNC) -- Quedo terminado el dia 18 el torneo de ciclismo iniciado el dia 8.
					  Esta cita deportiva se realizo en la competencia de cronometrar el tiempo y en la individual.
					
					  En la categoria de adultos resultaron ganadores Kim Chol Ryong (m) y Ryang Yu Mi (f) del Conjunto Deportivo del Ministerio de Industria Ligera, mientras en la clase de jovenes triunfaron Song Il (m) del Conjunto Deportivo Ryesonggang y Kim Ok Sim (f) del Conjunto Deportivo del Ministerio de Industria Ligera.
